Package imagingbook.pub.edgepreservingfilters

Class BilateralFilterVectorSeparable

  • java.lang.Object
    • imagingbook.lib.filter.GenericFilter
      • imagingbook.lib.filter.GenericFilterVectorSeparable
        • imagingbook.pub.edgepreservingfilters.BilateralFilterVectorSeparable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ProgressReporter, BilateralF
    public class BilateralFilterVectorSeparable
extends GenericFilterVectorSeparable
implements BilateralF
    Separable vector version, for RGB images only (accepts ColorProcessor only). This class implements a bilateral filter as proposed in C. Tomasi and R. Manduchi, "Bilateral Filtering for Gray and Color Images", Proceedings of the 1998 IEEE International Conference on Computer Vision, Bombay, India. The filter uses Gaussian domain and range kernels and can be applied to all image types.
    Version:
    2021/01/01

    • Method Detail

      • doPixelX

        protected float[] doPixelX​(PixelPack source,
                           int u,
                           int v)
        Description copied from class: GenericFilterVectorSeparable
        Applies a 1D filter operation in x-direction. This method must be implemented by concrete sub-classes. This method is invoked before GenericFilterVectorSeparable.doPixelY(PixelPack, int, int). The source data are passed as a PixelPack container, which holds the vector values of all image components. The method PixelPack.getVec(int, int) should be used to read individual pixel vectors. These data should not be modified but the (float[]) result of the single-pixel calculation must be returned. Implementations are free to return the same float-array at each invocation, i.e., there is no need to allocate a new array every time.
        Specified by:
        doPixelX in class GenericFilterVectorSeparable
        Parameters:
        source - the scalar-valued data for a single image component
        u - the current x-position
        v - the current y-position
        Returns:
        the result of the filter calculation for this pixel

      • doPixelY

        protected float[] doPixelY​(PixelPack source,
                           int u,
                           int v)
        Description copied from class: GenericFilterVectorSeparable
        Applies a 1D filter operation in y-direction. This method must be implemented by concrete sub-classes. This method is invoked after GenericFilterVectorSeparable.doPixelX(PixelPack, int, int). The source data are passed as a PixelPack container, which holds the vector values of all image components. The method PixelPack.getVec(int, int) should be used to read individual pixel vectors. These data should not be modified but the (float[]) result of the single-pixel calculation must be returned. Implementations are free to return the same float-array at each invocation, i.e., there is no need to allocate a new array every time.
        Specified by:
